Preparing Your Data

2019-07-23

setting_up_dm.Rmd

This document describes how you can get your data into a dm object. Though this example is also built in already — just run cdm_nycflights13() — here, we’ll go through the process step by step.

The five tables we are working with contain information on flights from airports of the North-American city of New York to other destinations in the United States in 2013 and are available through the package nycflights13.

  • flights represents the journeys taken by planes,
  • airlines includes
    • transport organizations’ names (name)
    • their shortcuts (carrier)
  • airports indicates the ports of departure (origin) and of destination (dest)
  • weater the meterological context at each hour
  • planes describes aircrafts’ characteristics

Once we’ve loaded nycflights13, the aforementioned tables are all in our work environment, ready for being accessed.

library(dm)
library(nycflights13)

Adding Tables

First, we will tell dm what tables we want to work with and how they’re connected. For this, we can use dm or as_dm(). as_dm() accepts lists of objects. You must explicitly name the objects if you use list() (f.e. list("airlines" = airlines, "flights" = flights)) — here we use tibble::lst() which automatically names the list components.

flights_dm_no_keys <- tibble::lst(airlines, airports, flights, planes, weather) %>%
  as_dm()

Defining Keys

Though you now have a new dm object, containing all your data, a key detail is missing still: How your five tables are connected the foreign keys) and which column(s) uniquely identify observation (the primary keys).

Primary Keys

dm offers cdm_enum_pk_candidates() to identify primary keys and cdm_add_pk() to add them.

cdm_enum_pk_candidates(
  dm = flights_dm_no_keys,
  table = planes
)
## # A tibble: 9 x 2
##   column       candidate
##   <chr>        <lgl>    
## 1 tailnum      TRUE     
## 2 year         FALSE    
## 3 type         FALSE    
## 4 manufacturer FALSE    
## 5 model        FALSE    
## 6 engines      FALSE    
## 7 seats        FALSE    
## 8 speed        FALSE    
## 9 engine       FALSE

Now, add any primary keys you may have identified:

flights_dm_only_pks <- flights_dm_no_keys %>%
  cdm_add_pk(table = airlines, column = carrier) %>%
  cdm_add_pk(airports, faa) %>%
  cdm_add_pk(planes, tailnum)
flights_dm_only_pks
## ── Table source ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## src:  <environment: 0x611a7c8>
## ── Data model ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Data model object:
##   5 tables:  airlines, airports, flights, planes ... 
##   53 columns
##   3 primary keys
##   no references
## ── Rows ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Total: 367687
## airlines: 16, airports: 1458, flights: 336776, planes: 3322, weather: 26115

To get an overview of the primary keys after setting them, call cdm_get_all_pks().

cdm_get_all_pks(flights_dm_only_pks)
## # A tibble: 3 x 3
##   table    pk_col  pk_class 
##   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    
## 1 airlines carrier character
## 2 airports faa     character
## 3 planes   tailnum character

Foreign Keys

cdm_enum_fk_candidates(
  dm = flights_dm_only_pks,
  table = flights,
  ref_table = airlines
)
## # A tibble: 19 x 5
##    ref_table ref_table_pk table   column         candidate
##    <chr>     <chr>        <chr>   <chr>          <lgl>    
##  1 airlines  carrier      flights year           FALSE    
##  2 airlines  carrier      flights month          FALSE    
##  3 airlines  carrier      flights day            FALSE    
##  4 airlines  carrier      flights dep_time       FALSE    
##  5 airlines  carrier      flights sched_dep_time FALSE    
##  6 airlines  carrier      flights dep_delay      FALSE    
##  7 airlines  carrier      flights arr_time       FALSE    
##  8 airlines  carrier      flights sched_arr_time FALSE    
##  9 airlines  carrier      flights arr_delay      FALSE    
## 10 airlines  carrier      flights carrier        TRUE     
## 11 airlines  carrier      flights flight         FALSE    
## 12 airlines  carrier      flights tailnum        FALSE    
## 13 airlines  carrier      flights origin         FALSE    
## 14 airlines  carrier      flights dest           FALSE    
## 15 airlines  carrier      flights air_time       FALSE    
## 16 airlines  carrier      flights distance       FALSE    
## 17 airlines  carrier      flights hour           FALSE    
## 18 airlines  carrier      flights minute         FALSE    
## 19 airlines  carrier      flights time_hour      FALSE

You define how your tables relate using cdm_add_fk(). First, define the tables you wish to connect to another using the function’s options table and ref_table. Then indicate in column which column of table refers to ref_table’s primary key, which you’ve defined above. Use check = FALSE to omit consistency checks.

flights_dm_all_keys <- flights_dm_only_pks %>%
  cdm_add_fk(table = flights, column = tailnum, ref_table = planes, check = FALSE) %>%
  cdm_add_fk(flights, carrier, airlines) %>%
  cdm_add_fk(flights, origin, airports)
flights_dm_all_keys
## ── Table source ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## src:  <environment: 0x611a7c8>
## ── Data model ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Data model object:
##   5 tables:  airlines, airports, flights, planes ... 
##   53 columns
##   3 primary keys
##   3 references
## ── Rows ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Total: 367687
## airlines: 16, airports: 1458, flights: 336776, planes: 3322, weather: 26115

Retrieving Keys

To retrieve your keys later on, use cdm_get_all_fks() or cdm_get_fk() for its singular version.

cdm_get_all_pks(flights_dm_all_keys)
## # A tibble: 3 x 3
##   table    pk_col  pk_class 
##   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    
## 1 airlines carrier character
## 2 airports faa     character
## 3 planes   tailnum character

Voilà, here’s your dm object that you can work with:

flights_dm_all_keys
## ── Table source ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## src:  <environment: 0x611a7c8>
## ── Data model ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Data model object:
##   5 tables:  airlines, airports, flights, planes ... 
##   53 columns
##   3 primary keys
##   3 references
## ── Rows ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
## Total: 367687
## airlines: 16, airports: 1458, flights: 336776, planes: 3322, weather: 26115
